thread.title: Indian rupee depreciates 7 paise against US dollar
thread.title_full: Indian rupee depreciates 7 paise against US dollar | The Financial Express

author: financialexpress.com
title: Indian rupee depreciates 7 paise against US dollar
text:
Other Articles RBI to maintain status quo on Aug 4; rate cut by March 2016: Morgan Stanley Cost cutting eases strong-dollar pain for American Express PSU Banks opt for offbeat tactics to tackle $49 billion of bad debts The Indian rupee weakened 7 paise to 63.65 against the US dollar in early trade today at the Interbank Foreign Exchange following gains in the American currency against major currencies globally.
Dealers said rupee weakened due to increased demand for the dollar from importers. A higher opening in the domestic equity market limited the rupeeâ€™s fall, they added.
The rupee ended marginally lower by three paise at 63.58 against the US dollar yesterday on mild demand for the American currency from banks and importers.
Meanwhile, the benchmark Sensex rose further by 73.40 points, or 0.25 per cent, to 28,578.33 in early trade.
 23, 2015 10:13 am
